overview: This subject examines the design, delivery, and evaluation of positive interventions and approaches to fostering wellbeing and other positive outcomes across a range of contexts, such as at home, in the workplace, and in the local community. Nuances of delivery format in each delivery setting will be presented, discussed and critiqued. Ethical issues associated with applying positive interventions relevant to each context will be discussed, drawing upon guidelines from various disciplines. Strategies for evaluating the effectiveness, efficacy, and implementation of interventions and programs will be considered. Through experiential approaches, students will gain clarity on the design and implementation of programs, an appreciation of ethical practice, and understanding of basic evaluation skills.
intended learning outcomes: Identify positive psychology and wellbeing-related interventions and approaches.
Illustrate factors that impact the applications of positive interventions and approaches.
Critically evaluate practices and interventions employed in positive psychology, wellbeing science, and related disciplines.
Develop ethically sensitive approaches to improve wellbeing across a range of contexts.
Demonstrate reflective practice regarding learning and professional application of positive approaches.

additional pre-requisite: Students that commenced their course prior to 2022 may have completed EDUC90787 Principles of Positive Psychology.

non-allowed subjects: EDUC90788 Applications of Positive Psychology (no longer offered)

assessments.description: Online open book test on wellbeing-related interventions (1000 words equivalent). 60 minutes
Written essay on positive interventions. 2000 words
Case study report applying positive interventions. 2000 words
Hurdle requirement:. Attendance at a minimum of 75% at all synchronous sessions
